intro: Adelobotrys boissierianus, commonly known as the Boissier's adenocaulon, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Mediterranean. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, a common feature among members of its family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or limestone habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
